name: hostname
description: Get or set the system hostname.
remarks:
- When no options are provided, the module gathers the current hostname facts and returns them as JSON.
- When "name" is provided, the module sets the transient hostname (runtime) and optionally persists it to the appropriate config
  (e.g., /etc/hostname for most Linux distros or hostnamectl if available).
- The module attempts to be idempotent: if the current hostname already matches the desired one, changed=false.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Desired hostname. If omitted, module only gathers current hostname facts.

parameters.name: persist
parameters.description: Whether to persist the hostname to system config (e.g., /etc/hostname).

examples:
- name: Get hostname facts
  hostname: {}

- name: Set runtime hostname only
  hostname:
    name: "app-node-01"

- name: Set and persist hostname
  hostname:
    name: "app-node-01"
    persist: true

children.name: fqdn
children.description: Fully-qualified domain name if resolvable, otherwise the plain hostname.

children.name: domain
children.description: Derived domain part from FQDN (empty if not applicable).

returns.name: changed
returns.description: Whether this module changed anything on the target.

returns.name: failed
returns.description: Whether the module failed (non-zero exit code, validation failure, etc.).

returns.name: msg
returns.description: Human-readable message describing the outcome or error.

returns.name: attempts
returns.description:
Number of attempts performed so far (e.g., by `until`).
Typically increments from 1 upwards.

returns.name: retries
returns.description:
Maximum retries allowed for this operation (e.g., by `until`).
This reflects the configured ceiling, not the attempts taken.
